No, touching a person with leprosy does not cure the disease; treatment requires a multidrug regimen (rifampicin, dapsone, clofazimine) administered over 6–12 months, as outlined in WHO’s leprosy guidelines (Multidrug therapy for leprosy, 2020, WHO; https://www.who.int/leprosy/clinical-management/en/).

Air is denser than water vapor at the same temperature and pressure because its average molecular weight (~29 g mol⁻¹) is higher than that of water vapor (~18 g mol⁻¹) (See “The Atmosphere” (1941, Nature)).

Yes – the ISS is still under Earth's gravity (≈90 % of surface gravity) but orbits in free fall, producing weightlessness (NASA, “Space Station Structure”, 2023, https://www.nasa.gov/mission_pages/station/structure/space_station_overview.html).

A 10‑foot shift in Earth’s orbital radius would alter the solar irradiance by only about 4 × 10⁻¹¹ (≈0.000000004 %) and would therefore have no perceptible effect on Earth’s climate, orbital period, day length, tides, or other geophysical processes (NASA Solar System: Earth–Sun distance).

No foods have been proven to cause type 1 diabetes; it is an autoimmune disease driven by genetic susceptibility and environmental triggers, not a specific diet (Type 1 Diabetes: Pathogenesis and Management, 2022, Nature Reviews Endocrinology).

No – a praying mantis is not listed as a protected species under the U.S. Endangered Species Act or most state wildlife statutes, so there is no law that makes its killing illegal (see U.S. Fish & Wildlife Service ESA list of protected species). (U.S. Fish & Wildlife Service, 2024, https://www.fws.gov/laws/lawsdigest/ESA.html)

Yes, by definition every cat—any member of the genus Felis such as Felis catus—is a cat (see Wikipedia “Felis catus” article, 2023).

Undercover officers in the U.S. are not generally required to disclose their identity; the only legal way to compel identification is through a court‑issued subpoena or other judicial order, which must be tailored to the specific case and may be subject to protective measures that limit the release of sensitive operational details (e.g., *Undercover Policing and Civil Rights*, 2015, Law & Society Review). (https://www.justice.gov/archives)
